programme.title: Mountain Men
programme.desc: Morgan's first flight over the peaks leaves him in a dead skid over the edge, Marty fights to double down on a big payday, while Eustace bites off more than he can chew to get the job done. Jason takes River on a mountain rite of passage.

programme.title: UFO Hunters
programme.desc: An investigation into accounts by witnesses who allegedly saw military helicopters transporting a UFO in Needles, California, in 2008.

programme.title: UFO Hunters
programme.desc: The team heads to Area 51, the epicentre of UFO conspiracies, to meet former employees of the alleged storage site for alien space craft.

programme.title: American Pickers
programme.desc: Mike and Frank rummage around a machine shop in search of rare collectibles.

programme.title: A Very British Road Trip with John Thompson and Simon Day
programme.desc: John Thomson and Simon Day go on a humorous tour to examine bizarre traditions in Britain's counties, starting with a visit to the Cornish coast.

programme.title: A Very British Road Trip with John Thompson and Simon Day
programme.desc: John Thomson and Simon Day join a pagan group and take part in a sheepdog trial when they visit Carmarthenshire.

programme.title: American Restoration
programme.desc: The team works on a custom-made car from a 1940s fairground ride, and a client brings in an unusual bicycle.

programme.title: American Restoration
programme.desc: A regular customer brings Rick a hand-powered railway cart from the 1800s, which the team strive to turn into a museum exhibit.

programme.title: Hardcore Pawn
programme.desc: The Golds clash over whether they should be armed after Les's confrontation with a customer, and Ashley fails to close a deal.

programme.title: Hardcore Pawn
programme.desc: The Golds clash when a man brings in an angry pet alligator he wants rid of. Les has to keep his composure to avoid making a bad decision.

programme.title: American Pickers
programme.desc: Mike makes a gamble by buying an elephant's head from a taxidermist, and the guys are tempted to purchase an antique hot dog steamer.

programme.title: Bible Secrets Revealed
programme.desc: Scholars, archaeologists and religious leaders attempt to get to the bottom of the mysteries and unanswered questions posed by the Bible.

programme.title: UFO Hunters
programme.desc: An investigation into whether sightings of triangular ships are UFOs or attributable to military aircraft.

programme.title: American Restoration
programme.desc: A champion driver and a track owner from the Nascar motor racing circuit challenge Rick to design a trophy for a high-profile race.

programme.title: American Restoration
programme.desc: Rick Dale examines a 100-year-old mutoscope, while his brother and his son take an interest in a tandem they spot in a client's house.

programme.title: Pawn Stars
programme.desc: The guys value a 1920s car with wooden wheels and a ball and chain from Arizona's oldest prison.

programme.title: Pawn Stars
programme.desc: Rick is placed in a difficult position when a client offers him a set of Saddam Hussein's fingerprints, originally taken by the FBI.

programme.title: Storage Wars
programme.desc: Buyers Darrell, Brandon, Jarrod, Brandi and Ivy head to El Monte, California, where they tackle the local competition head-on.

programme.title: Storage Wars
programme.desc: The buyers head to the hills of Murrieta for an auction that has tensions and prices running high. Dave drives Darrell to breaking-point.

programme.title: Hardcore Pawn
programme.desc: The Golds clash over whether they should be armed after Les's confrontation with a customer, and Ashley fails to close a deal.

programme.title: Hardcore Pawn
programme.desc: The Golds clash when a man brings in an angry pet alligator he wants rid of. Les has to keep his composure to avoid making a bad decision.

programme.title: Forged in Fire
programme.desc: With a variety of metal objects to choose their metal from, four new competitors attempt to forge a knife in their own style before taking on the Boar Spear.

programme.title: America's Book of Secrets
programme.desc: Documentary exploring some of the biggest scandals and conspiracies to rock the US prison system, including Pennsylvania's 2008 'kids for cash' scandal.

programme.title: UFO Hunters
programme.desc: The team investigates disturbingly similar stories of alien abductions from two different countries before tracking down some potential proof in Mexico.

programme.title: Bible Secrets Revealed
programme.desc: Experts examine 'the promised land', which is considered the most sacred place on Earth. However, it has also been carved up and fought over for thousands of years.

programme.title: Hardcore Pawn
programme.desc: Tensions mount when a man loses his temper over a mix-up with his gold chain. Meanwhile, an allegedly cursed relic scares Ashley.

programme.title: Hardcore Pawn
programme.desc: An employee shocks the family by turning violent, and Ashley loses her temper when someone tries to steal her underwear.

programme.title: Storage Wars
programme.desc: Rene and Casey return to the auctions only to be greeted by fierce competition. Dave finds a piece of board game history.

programme.title: Storage Wars
programme.desc: Darrell and Brandon have high hopes when they return to the site of one of their greatest triumphs, while the other bidders take on the self-proclaimed king of storage.

programme.title: Wicked Tuna
programme.desc: The captains are pushed to breaking point when a novice fisherman and pleasure boaters cause them to lose thousands of dollars' worth of bluefin tuna.

programme.title: Forged in Fire
programme.desc: Four competing bladesmiths are tasked with forging a bowie knife. Two make it through to the final round where they must recreate a deadly saber called the Shamshir.

programme.title: Greatest Moments in Football
programme.sub-title: Pele & The Boys From Brazil & Argentina
programme.desc: Focusing on Pele and the Brazil and Argentina teams of the 1970s, including a look at their political importance.

programme.title: Storage Wars
programme.desc: Buyers Darrell, Brandon, Jarrod, Brandi and Ivy head to El Monte, California, where they tackle the local competition head-on.

programme.title: Storage Wars
programme.desc: The buyers head to the hills of Murrieta for an auction that has tensions and prices running high. Dave drives Darrell to breaking-point.

programme.title: QI
programme.desc: Panellists David Mitchell, Bill Bailey, Phill Jupitus and Alan Davies tackle questions about China, Corby and coffee, with points going to the answers host Stephen Fry finds the most interesting.

programme.title: Would I Lie to You?
programme.desc: Celebrity guests Ruth Jones, Jason Manford, Jack Dee and Peter Serafinowicz join team captains David Mitchell and Lee Mack for the comedy panel show, in which contestants try to hoodwink their opponents with absurd facts and plausible lies about themselves. Presented by Rob Brydon.

programme.title: Would I Lie to You?
programme.desc: Team captains David Mitchell and Lee Mack are joined by actress Keeley Hawes, actor Stephen Mangan, comedian Kevin Bridges and physicist Brian Cox for the comedy panel show, in which contestants try to hoodwink their opponents with absurd facts and plausible lies about themselves. Hosted by Rob Brydon.

programme.title: QI XL
programme.desc: Jenny Eclair, Johnny Vegas and Bill Bailey join regular panellist Alan Davies for an extended edition of the quiz show, in which Stephen Fry awards points for the answers he finds most interesting - regardless of whether they are correct. This time, the Stephen Fry prepares for the festive period with some seasonal merriment.

programme.title: Mock the Week
programme.desc: Topical comedy show, with Rob Beckett, Ed Byrne, Milton Jones, Romesh Ranganathan and Holly Walsh joining Dara O Briain and Hugh Dennis to take a comic look at recent world events, through stand-up and improvised games. First shown in October 2015.

programme.title: Would I Lie to You?
programme.desc: Celebrity guests Ruth Jones, Jason Manford, Jack Dee and Peter Serafinowicz join team captains David Mitchell and Lee Mack for the comedy panel show, in which contestants try to hoodwink their opponents with absurd facts and plausible lies about themselves. Presented by Rob Brydon.

programme.title: Teleshopping
programme.desc: A chance to buy goods from the comfort of home.

programme.title: Teleshopping
programme.desc: A chance to buy goods from the comfort of home.

programme.title: Jay Leno's Garage
programme.desc: Chat show legend Jay Leno and an array of guests explore the links between outer space and cars, and Jay gets an education in going fast and drives the Mars Rover.

programme.title: American Pickers
programme.desc: Mike tries to buy a set of art deco cigarette machines, and one of the duo's recent purchases leaves an appraiser speechless.

programme.title: Storage Hunters UK
programme.desc: US host Sean Kelly oversees Hampshire bidders battling to win potential treasures found in storage containers, lock-ups and garages.

programme.title: Storage Hunters UK
programme.desc: US host Sean Kelly oversees bidders in Preston, where Heavy D's gamble might just leave him with the hump, and viewers see if Jesse has what it takes to win big in the UK.

programme.title: American Pickers
programme.desc: Mike and Frank find a huge sculpture of Elvis and trawl through a trailer full of rare art and military memorabilia.

programme.title: American Pickers
programme.desc: Mike Wolfe and Frank Fritz stage a picking intervention in Massachusetts, and later help a collector whose massive stockpile is facing eviction.

programme.title: James May's Cars of the People
programme.desc: The presenter continues his examination of how the car became an everyday part of people's lives, exploring the weird world of small vehicles. He discovers how austerity and fears of congestion led to European disasters in the shape of Britain's infamous three-wheelers, French death traps and German absurdities, and also takes to the battlefield to settle one of the greatest rivalries in car history.

programme.title: World's Most Dangerous Roads
programme.desc: Celebrities undertake some of the most perilous journeys in the world. Comedians Ed Byrne and Andy Parsons drive along Siberia's M56 Kolyma highway, known as the 'Road of Bones'. Along the way, they brave sub-zero temperatures, traverse icy routes, encounter deserted gulags and meet the locals who inhabit the frozen wilderness, but despite picking up practical tips for survival, the duo feel they are out of their depth.

programme.title: American Pickers
programme.desc: Mike tries to buy a set of art deco cigarette machines, and one of the duo's recent purchases leaves an appraiser speechless.

programme.title: Timber Kings
programme.desc: Peter helps restore a Manitoba couple's love for logs by building a home to replace the one they tragically lost to fire.

programme.title: Eddie Eats America
programme.desc: Eddie gets a taste of Cuba in Miami's fresh seafood, sets his sights at a shooting range, and heads cross-state to attempt a huge surf & turf challenge created just for him.

programme.title: Eddie Eats America
programme.desc: Stoke strongman Eddie Hall visits cosmopolitan Queens, NY, to make a solo attempt at a huge Greek kebab banquet, sample the best Chinese dumplings and try his hand at baseball.

programme.title: Top Gear
programme.desc: The presenters try to impress Oxford residents by building an electric car, and refuse to let an unenthusiastic response deter them from sitting in on the machine's crash-test before handing it over to the Stig's environmentally friendly cousin. Actor Michael Sheen is the Star in a Reasonably Priced Car, and Jeremy Clarkson pits the Corvette ZR1 against the Audi R8 V10

programme.title: Eddie Eats America
programme.desc: Eddie Hall, winner of the 2017 World's Strongest Man contest, tours the USA on a quest to conquer the biggest and best eye-watering food and physical challenges. Eddie lands in Florida Keys to attempt a conch-fritter eating record, do some serious big-game fishing and try what's billed as the best Key Lime Pie on earth.

programme.title: Eddie Eats America
programme.desc: Eddie Hall squares up to the Mac & Cheese Challenge at Brooklyn's Mac Shack - which weighs in at more than two kilograms and nearly 7,000 calories of pasta, cheese and sauce.

programme.title: Would I Lie to You?
programme.desc: Comedian and writer David Baddiel, former MP and Strictly Come Dancing 2016 star Ed Balls, stand-up and actress Jo Brand and ex-Pussycat Doll and Celebrity MasterChef 2015 winner Kimberly Wyatt join host Rob Brydon and captains David Mitchell and Lee Mack on the comedy panel show. As usual, the participants aim to hoodwink their opponents with absurd facts and plausible lies about themselves in a bid to secure a team victory.

programme.title: Would I Lie to You?
programme.desc: Porridge star Mark Bonnar, actress Sheila Hancock, actor Stephen Mangan and radio and TV presenter Anita Rani join team captains David Mitchell and Lee Mack on the comedy panel show in which participants attempt to hoodwink their opponents with absurd facts and plausible lies about themselves. Hosted by Rob Brydon.

programme.title: QI
programme.desc: Panellists David Mitchell, Bill Bailey, Phill Jupitus and Alan Davies tackle questions about China, Corby and coffee, with points going to the answers host Stephen Fry finds the most interesting.

programme.title: QI
programme.desc: Sandi Toksvig hosts the quiz with a difference as comedians Hannah Gadsby, Noel Fielding and Joe Lycett join regular panellist Alan Davies to answer questions on the theme of pictures, with points being awarded not only for correct answers, but also for interesting ones.

programme.title: Dave Gorman: Terms and Conditions Apply
programme.desc: Using his trademark, powerpoint-comedy and a series of mischievous games, Dave invites three of the country's finest comic minds to help him make sense of our insensible world. In the first episode he is joined by Richard Osman, Phil Wang and Sara Barron, as they take a deep dive into the details we usually miss.

programme.title: Mock the Week
programme.desc: Host Dara O Briain and regular panellist Hugh Dennis serve up their unique festive take in a Christmas special filled with seasonal material, out-takes, best bits and hitherto unseen moments.

programme.title: QI
programme.desc: With panellists Bill Bailey, Alan Davies, Andy Hamilton and Helen Atkinson-Wood. Stephen Fry poses questions on chimpanzees, chromosomes and cuttlefish, awarding points to the answers he finds most intriguing.

programme.title: Secret Nazi Bases
programme.desc: A secret weapons program in the heart of Austria that could have ended badly for the Allies - and may have indicated nuclear plans being concocted by Hitler.

programme.title: Abandoned Engineering
programme.desc: A seemingly endless concrete line stretching through the French countryside, which sits as a monument to a discarded engineering advancement.

programme.title: Slow Train Through Africa with Griff Rhys Jones
programme.desc: The comedian makes five train journeys taking in the spectacular sights of Africa, travelling to unexpected places in deserts and forests, villages and cities, and finding out how the railways are used today. On the fourth leg of his journey across the continent, Griff travels across Namibia in the south-west, experiencing luxury camping, encountering cheetahs, and visiting 1,000-foot sand dunes.

programme.title: History's Ultimate Spies
programme.desc: As a Protestant, Queen Elizabeth I lived with the threat of assassination from Catholics throughout her reign. Thankfully, there was an army of men available to work in secret under spy master Francis Walsingham with the sole aim of protecting her. As this documentary reveals, Walsingham was able to demonstrate remarkable cunning in his role.

programme.title: Teleshopping
programme.desc: A chance to buy goods from the comfort of home.

programme.title: Raiders of the Lost Past
programme.sub-title: The Men Who Found the Maya
programme.desc: The documentary investigating the stories of explorers who put everything on the line to find sought-after objects returns, beginning with a look at American lawyer John Lloyd Stephens and British artist Frederick Catherwood - the men who found the Maya civilization.

programme.title: Slow Train Through Africa with Griff Rhys Jones
programme.desc: The comedian makes five train journeys taking in the spectacular sights of Africa, travelling to unexpected places in deserts and forests, villages and cities, and finding out how the railways are used today. He begins in the north, on a line that links the trading cities of Morocco, Algeria and Tunisia. Stocking up for his trip at a souk in Marrakesh, he boards the train for a seven-hour ride to the ancient city of Fes, and eventually reaches the Sahara - and his final destination of Tozeur.

programme.title: Time Team
programme.sub-title: The Time Team Guide to Burial
programme.desc: Tony Robinson and the team revisit ancient burial sites around the country, including Bronze Age cemeteries, Roman mausoleums and decorative Anglo-Saxon resting places to reveal how funeral customs have developed and evolved over thousands of years of British history.

programme.title: Time Team
programme.sub-title: The Forgotten Gunners of WW1: A Time Team Special
programme.desc: The team visits Belton House stately home near Grantham, Lincolnshire, to investigate the creation of the Machine Gun Corps during the First World War. The regiment was set up in the grounds, but today there is virtually no sign of its existence and most regimental records have been destroyed. The dig, however, is rich in finds, revealing glimpses of the lives of the thousands of men who trained at the site, many of whom died in battle.

programme.title: Secret Nazi Bases
programme.desc: A mile-and-a half of recently-excavated trenches, bunkers, barracks, and gun encasements near Pointe du Hoc, which tell a new story of D-Day.

programme.title: Viking Dead
programme.sub-title: The Secret Viking Grave of Ridgeway Hill
programme.desc: Archaeologists investigate the discovery of a mass grave in Dorset, and try to determine if the bodies are the remains of Vikings.

programme.title: Impossible Railways
programme.desc: The wilderness lines that have pushed the frontiers of human endeavour into previously unknown territories, solving a set of complex problems along the way.

programme.title: Time Team
programme.sub-title: The Forgotten Gunners of WW1: A Time Team Special
programme.desc: The team visits Belton House stately home near Grantham, Lincolnshire, to investigate the creation of the Machine Gun Corps during the First World War. The regiment was set up in the grounds, but today there is virtually no sign of its existence and most regimental records have been destroyed. The dig, however, is rich in finds, revealing glimpses of the lives of the thousands of men who trained at the site, many of whom died in battle.

programme.title: David Attenborough's Natural Curiosities
programme.desc: David Attenborough examines the vision in squid and owls, which have both developed incredible adaptations to help them navigate at night.

programme.title: David Attenborough's Natural Curiosities
programme.desc: David Attenborough takes a look at animals that rely on other species, from cuckoos planting their eggs in other birds' nests to the death's-head hawkmoth stealing honey.

programme.title: Life in the Undergrowth
programme.desc: The story of the invertebrates that left the sea to move on to land 400 million years ago. Since then, they have become the most successful group of animals, without which the land's ecosystem would collapse. David Attenborough examines the insects' behaviour, travelling to South Africa and Venezuela to witness the habits and routines of millipedes and centipedes.

programme.title: Impossible Engineering
programme.desc: A colossal American football stadium in Texas, that features the world's largest retractable roof and is able to seat over 100,000 spectators with no restricted viewpoints.

programme.title: Viking Dead
programme.sub-title: The Secret Viking Grave of Ridgeway Hill
programme.desc: Archaeologists investigate the discovery of a mass grave in Dorset, and try to determine if the bodies are the remains of Vikings.

programme.title: Secret Nazi Bases
programme.desc: A mile-and-a half of recently-excavated trenches, bunkers, barracks, and gun encasements near Pointe du Hoc, which tell a new story of D-Day.

programme.title: Impossible Railways
programme.desc: How the most incredible bridges from around the world help to solve a series of spanning problems. Featuring the world's longest single-span box girder bridge in Wales.

programme.title: Secrets of Britain
programme.desc: The series examining some of the UK's landmarks continues, with a look at the history of subterranean London, uncovering Roman remains, plague pits and secret bunkers under the capital's streets.

programme.title: Steam Train Britain
programme.desc: Ffestiniog and Welsh Highland Railway are celebrating their annual Victorian Weekend, while in south Devon, silver service waiter Andy Leech runs the three-course Sunday lunch.

programme.title: The World at War
programme.desc: How Japan's early victories over Allied forces during the Second World War convinced its people that their strength and discipline would bring them victory. Narrated by Laurence Olivier.

programme.title: Porridge
programme.desc: Fletch plans to bring a bit of Christmas spirit to Slade Prison in the form of his own home-made booze. But when Mackay and Barrowclough uncover the stash in his and Godber's cell, the crafty con seems in danger of spending the yuletide period in solitary confinement. Festive edition of the classic comedy from 1976, starring Ronnie Barker and Fulton Mackay.

programme.title: Waking the Dead
programme.desc: Feature-length episode. The team discovers a link between a mummified body and a Notting Hill house that featured as the location for a murderous fight between gangsters in a 1960s film, and present-day renovation work reveals more skeletons behind the walls. Spencer complicates matters further by revealing he lived there with his family when the events must have taken place. Crime drama, starring Trevor Eve, Sue Johnston and Holly Aird.

programme.title: Rebus
programme.desc: The maverick detective finds his career on the line once more when an apparently watertight murder prosecution collapses because of his unconventional interrogation methods. Facing the wrath of the victim's family - not to mention his own colleagues - Rebus digs deeper, but finds himself caught up in a spate of gangland revenge killings. Nicholas Farrell guest stars, with Ken Stott and Claire Price.

programme.title: Boon
programme.desc: Ken and Harry pose as conference organisers in a bid to prove the innocence of a former head of security at a leading hotel, while Rocky and Alex carry out an elaborate burglary.

programme.title: Garden Hopping
programme.desc: Daphne Ledward visits the stunning Rowden Gardens on Dartmoor - one of the participants in the National Gardens Scheme.

programme.title: Teleshopping
programme.desc: A chance to buy goods from the comfort of home.

programme.title: Teleshopping
programme.desc: A chance to buy goods from the comfort of home.

programme.title: The House of Eliott
programme.desc: The sisters are faced with the prospect of either selling up or accepting money from Lord Montford and Jack Maddox - an option neither is keen to contemplate.

programme.title: Soldier, Soldier
programme.desc: Rumours start to circulate about Colonel Hammond's love life, and the fusiliers suspect his loyalties will be compromised by his new love.

programme.title: Soldier, Soldier
programme.desc: Bernie Roberts looks to be the guilty party when she is involved in a road accident. Meanwhile, Kieron Voce faces criticism from senior officers.

programme.title: Holby City
programme.desc: Connie feels Will's bedside manner needs improving and makes it clear she has no respect for his privileged upbringing. She orders him to go out for a drink with her and discovers a few surprising secrets about his background. Diane returns to work for the first time since her sister's death, but some of her colleagues think she hasn't given herself enough time to deal with the grief, or taking on the responsibility of raising Joanna's child. When she breaks down during the shift, it becomes clear she blames herself for the tragedy.

programme.title: The Bill
programme.desc: Samantha is horrified to discover her daughter Abi is involved with a local criminal whose activities are currently the focus of a Sun Hill investigation. Behind the scenes, Gina Gold offers June and Jim the chance of a lavish all-expenses-paid reception as they prepare for their impending wedding - while a beetle-browed Gabriel Kent glowers menacingly in the background.

programme.title: The Bill
programme.desc: As June and Jim prepare to tie the knot, the past threatens to catch up with both of them and shatter their happiness. Evil Gabriel plays mind games with the pair, suggesting the marriage is merely a sham, while Jim's drunken ex-wife Marie makes an unscheduled appearance - but will love conquer all? The romance of the occasion goes to Reg and Marilyn's heads, while back at the station, Adam gets lured into a trap that could destroy his career.

programme.title: Classic EastEnders
programme.desc: Etta and Pauline receive a phone call from the Portsmouth police to be told that Michelle and Clyde have been caught, and Vicki and Kofi are in a children's home there.

programme.title: Classic EastEnders
programme.desc: Will Mark find Joe? And if he does, will Joe be able to give him any clues about Eddie's murderers?.

programme.title: Casualty
programme.desc: A suspicious woman is injured while spying on her fiance. Baz is advised of a patient who suffered a cardiac death after Daniel diagnosed him with indigestion. An argument between two brothers leads to an emotional disclosure, while a youth gets into more trouble than he imagined possible after stealing a car.

programme.title: Lovejoy
programme.desc: Part one of two. Lady Jane and Lovejoy grow closer while visiting a Gothic temple in Scotland. Eric falls head over heels in love and Tinker feels all at sea. Drama, with Ian McShane and Phyllis Logan.

programme.title: Bergerac
programme.desc: Inspector West announces the hunt for an escaped criminal is over, but Jim is unconvinced and refuses to drop the case. Starring John Nettles, Celia Imrie and Terence Alexander.

programme.title: Last of the Summer Wine
programme.desc: Barry takes advantage when he gets locked in the pub on Christmas night, but then is too scared to go home on Boxing Day. Festive special from 1990, starring Mike Grady, Peter Sallis and Bill Owen.

programme.title: Porridge
programme.desc: Fletch discovers fellow inmates at Slade Prison are planning an escape over Christmas - and is so convinced the bid is doomed to fail that he takes refuge in the hospital so he cannot be blamed when the tunnel is found. Festive edition of the classic comedy from 1975, starring Ronnie Barker and Richard Beckinsale.

programme.title: Porridge
programme.desc: Fletch plans to bring a bit of Christmas spirit to Slade Prison in the form of his own home-made booze. But when Mackay and Barrowclough uncover the stash in his and Godber's cell, the crafty con seems in danger of spending the yuletide period in solitary confinement. Festive edition of the classic comedy from 1976, starring Ronnie Barker and Fulton Mackay.

programme.title: The Inspector Lynley Mysteries
programme.desc: Feature-length episode. Lynley faces charges of intimidating a suspect, and is suspended from duty, meaning Havers and new partner DI Fiona Knight (guest star Liza Tarbuck) must investigate when the body of a woman is found in a lake. However, the detective involves himself in the case, compromising his chances of an unbiased trial. Crime drama, starring Nathaniel Parker and Sharon Small.

programme.title: New Tricks
programme.desc: A photo featuring a missing 19-year-old music student turns up in a charity shop donation bag on the anniversary of her disappearance 17 years earlier, prompting Sandra to suspect the work of a serial killer. However, as the team gets to work identifying and tracking down the other people in the picture, increasing pressure to hand over the investigation forces Sandra to consider her future, and she turns to a familiar face to help her make her decision. Amanda Redman stars, with Denis Lawson, Dennis Waterman and Nicholas Lyndhurst.

programme.title: Silent Witness
programme.desc: Feature-length episode. Nikki and Jack are called to a petrol station where three people have been shot dead, and conclude it is the work of a concealed shooter working from long range - a sniper is at large in London. They combine ballistics and wound pathology with the killer-profiling skills of senior investigator DCI Jane De Freitas, as they work to find this seemingly random murderer before panic hits the city. Starring Emilia Fox, David Caves and Richard Lintern, with Zoe Telford and Steve Wall.

programme.title: Rogue One: A Star Wars Story (2016)
programme.desc: In a galaxy far, far away, Jyn Erso - the maverick daughter of scientist Galen Erso - joins the Rebel Alliance. On the planet Scarif, she and the freedom fighters, including a blind warrior and a deadpan droid, attempt to steal plans for the Death Star, a battle station capable of destroying entire worlds, which was designed by her father on behalf of the Empire. However, the Rebels face tough competition from Imperial warlord Orson Krennic and shadowy forces, including Darth Vader, who will come to play a major part in the rise of the Empire. Star Wars prequel set before the events of A New Hope, starring Felicity Jones, Diego Luna and Ben Mendelsohn.

programme.title: Meet the Parents
programme.desc: Dating show, hosted by Holly Willoughby, which puts the love lives of singletons in the hands of the people they know best - their mum and dad. Each week, one man and one woman must choose from three potential partners, with their decisions solely based on an encounter with the contestants' parents.

programme.title: ITV Nightscreen
programme.desc: Text-based information service.

programme.title: Judge Rinder
programme.desc: Cameras follow criminal barrister Robert Rinder as he takes on real-life cases in a studio courtroom.

programme.title: Good Morning Britain
programme.desc: Morning magazine featuring a lively mix of news and current affairs, plus health, entertainment and lifestyle features.

programme.title: Lorraine
programme.desc: Entertainment, current affairs and fashion news, as well as showbiz stories and celebrity gossip. Presented by Lorraine Kelly.

programme.title: Judge Rinder
programme.desc: Cameras follow criminal barrister Robert Rinder as he takes on real-life cases in a studio courtroom.

programme.title: This Morning
programme.desc: A mix of celebrity chat, lifestyle features, advice and competitions.

programme.title: Loose Women
programme.desc: Celebrity interviews and topical studio discussion from a female perspective.

programme.title: STV News and Weather
programme.desc: Including regional weather forecast.

programme.title: Dickinson's Real Deal
programme.desc: David Dickinson and the experts are in Bradford, where Tim Hogarth has his eye on a silver sculpture of a stag and Michael Hogben's finds include a wooden portrait and a gold pocket watch.

programme.title: The Switch
programme.desc: Quiz hosted by Sanjeev Bhaskar in which players four contestants can accumulate big cash totals by answering questions in a series of rounds that alternate between easy and hard, before one gets to the final stage and the chance to double the prize pot.

programme.title: Tipping Point
programme.desc: Game show, hosted by Ben Shephard, in which contestants answer questions to win turns on an arcade-style machine. Dropping tokens down a choice of four chutes, they hope to knock piles of them off a moving shelf - and the more they collect, the greater the prize fund. The player who has won the least amount is then eliminated, and the last one standing competes for a 10,000 jackpot.

programme.title: Cash Trapped
programme.desc: Quiz hosted by Bradley Walsh in which six contestants battle it out across a series of fast-paced question rounds where the players must actively try to sabotage their opponents by beating them to the buzzer and trapping them out of the game. In the final round, the person who has earned the most cash will go head to head against the rest of the group to try to take their winnings home.

programme.title: STV News at Six and Weather
programme.desc: Including regional weather forecast.

programme.title: Emmerdale
programme.desc: Kim is triumphant when her plan works, Dawn is gutted by some news, and Leanna and Jacob rekindle their friendship.

programme.title: Coronation Street
programme.desc: Robert and Paula pick over the evidence against him, while Chesney and Gemma get by with a little help from their friends. Elsewhere, Tim discovers that his plan is fundamentally flawed.

programme.title: The Martin Lewis Money Show
programme.desc: With less than 10 per cent of consumers shopping around for a new broadband deal last year, the financial journalist explains how to avoid being one of the four million households who are being overcharged by their internet providers.

programme.title: Coronation Street
programme.desc: Michelle's revelations prompt the police to charge Robert, and Gemma feels under scrutiny during the Freshco photo shoot. Meanwhile, Roy shows an interest in Richard's hobby.

programme.title: Sticks and Stones
programme.desc: Sales associate Thomas Benson faints during a presentation pitch, meaning his team doesn't get the contract or the lucrative bonus that would have been coming their way. His life starts to spiral out of control when he feels his colleagues are now out to get him and his work and home life are threatened. Psychological thriller, starring Ken Nwosu, Ben Miller, Alexandra Roach, Sean Sagar and Susannah Fielding.

programme.title: Scotland Tonight
programme.desc: Analysis of the day's headlines from a Scottish perspective, plus local news from Aberdeen, Edinburgh and Glasgow.

programme.title: Brothers in Football
programme.desc: Following south London amateur football team Corinthian-Casuals as they travel to Sao Paulo in Brazil to fulfil a tour abandoned 100 years before on the eve of the First World War, facing two-time FIFA Club World Cup-winners SC Corinthians Paulista. The documentary also commemorates the original Corinthian FC, a club credited with popularising the sport around the world.

programme.title: Salvage Hunters
programme.desc: Drew Pritchard visits one of his favourite houses and discovers a design classic, and later visits a museum in a giant windmill.

programme.title: Find It, Fix It, Flog It
programme.desc: Henry Cole and Simon O'Brien discover items including baby scales, an oil can and a glass cabinet that are ready for upcycling to turn a profit for their owners.

programme.title: The Repair Shop
programme.desc: The experts take on the challenges of restoring three cherished family heirlooms, bringing back to life a Victorian cuckoo clock, a 1970s bowl and a 200-year-old sea chest.

programme.title: The Repair Shop
programme.desc: Painting conservator Lucia Scalisi faces a serious challenge when presented with a perforated painting by celebrated British artist Fred Appleyard.

programme.title: World's Deadliest Drivers
programme.desc: More than 50 million people are injured every year on the roads, sparking a boom in dashboard cameras that capture a wealth of fascinating and surprising footage.

programme.title: World's Deadliest Drivers
programme.desc: More than 50 million people are injured every year on the roads, sparking a boom in dashboard cameras that capture a wealth of fascinating and surprising footage.

programme.title: Destroyed in Seconds
programme.desc: Heavy rains flood Utah and destroy neighbourhoods and an eight storey building collapses in the Filipino capital Manila. Plus, trains crash at a dangerous intersection and a stealth bomber interrupts a picnic.

programme.title: Destroyed in Seconds
programme.desc: An earthquake destroys a church, a tornado wreaks havoc in Oklahoma and a Delta 2 rocket explodes at Cape Canaveral.

programme.title: Wheeler Dealers
programme.desc: Mike Brewer seeks to get his hands on an expensive BMW 2002tii, and if he is to stay on budget, he must take a gamble on a model that has not been started for 17 years.

programme.title: Mysteries of the Missing
programme.desc: Terry O'Quinn turns his attention to the mysterious disappearance of 16th-century English colonists who settled on Roanoke Island, in what would later become North Carolina.

programme.title: Treasure Quest: Snake Island
programme.desc: A dangerous run-in leads the team to an astounding new clue, but a communications breakdown leaves them in the dark about an approaching storm.

programme.title: Outback Opal Hunters
programme.desc: With partner Dan stuck at home, Justin starts the new mining season alone. He is dealt a huge blow as he discovers their rich underground mine has been pegged by another miner.

programme.title: Outback Truckers
programme.desc: Turbo's rig begins to overheat midway through a vital run. Meanwhile, Mark Cromwell fights to complete the biggest job of his career to date.

programme.title: The Repair Shop
programme.desc: The experts take on the challenges of restoring three cherished family heirlooms, bringing back to life a Victorian cuckoo clock, a 1970s bowl and a 200-year-old sea chest.

programme.title: The Repair Shop
programme.desc: Painting conservator Lucia Scalisi faces a serious challenge when presented with a perforated painting by celebrated British artist Fred Appleyard.

programme.title: Chasing Classic Cars
programme.desc: Car restorer Wayne Carini fears a contact may have something to hide when he refuses to send photographs of some high-end classics he has on offer.

programme.title: Chasing Classic Cars
programme.desc: Car restorer Wayne Carini travels to Atlanta to see a rare Ferrari 275 GS, but an ownership dispute threatens the deal.

programme.title: Mysteries of the Missing
programme.desc: Terry O'Quinn sheds light on scientific evidence that suggests that three convicts who were believed to have drowned escaping Alcatraz prison in 1962 actually made it to shore.

programme.title: Outback Opal Hunters
programme.desc: Rookie Justin's second-hand excavator develops an expensive oil leak. Col's crew are a man down and the Fire Crew are on a wild goose-chase hunting a bounty of fabled fire opal.

programme.title: Treasure Quest: Snake Island
programme.desc: The team pushes deeper into the island than ever, tempting fate with every step, and make a discovery that will change their lives.

programme.title: Gold Divers
programme.desc: The dredgers draw in on the midpoint of the shortened mining season, and as it becomes clear that every expedition must count, small miscalculations lead to massive problems.

programme.title: Salvage Hunters
programme.desc: In a huge barn in Sussex, modern day treasure hunter Drew Pritchard discovers a large collection of animal-themed curiosities and objects. Then in Cardiff, his favourite kind of antiques are finally revealed.

programme.title: Outback Truckers
programme.desc: Russell battles waterlogged tracks in the desert as he tries to deliver his load on time, and Yogi's reputation hangs in the balance following the biggest week of his career.

programme.title: Wheeler Dealers
programme.desc: Auto enthusiast Mike Brewer finds an affordable Morgan to restore, but it provides mechanic Edd China with one of the biggest jobs he has ever faced.

programme.title: Outback Opal Hunters
programme.desc: The rookies suffer tension as a new partner leads them on a wild goose chase underground. Meanwhile, the Cooke Brothers' season gets off to a bad and dangerous start.

programme.title: Salvage Hunters
programme.desc: With his new shop opening to the public, Drew Pritchard needs more stock. He spots a '60s Danish sofa in Malvern, Worcestershire, and a pair of tapestries in Welshpool, Powys.

programme.title: Outback Truckers
programme.desc: Yogi prepares for a showdown with transport police in South Australia. Elsewhere, Nick and Jo take on one of their toughest jobs yet on one of Australia's worst roads.

programme.title: Rocky Mountain Railroad
programme.desc: Springtime in the Rockies sees the repair teams out in force. Veteran conductor Jordy Hunter must dodge the operations in order to make his delivery on time.

programme.title: How Do They Do It?
programme.desc: Transforming weeds into walls using a substance made out of hemp and concrete. Plus, how skydiving suits help people fly, and the production of the Swedish fish dish surstromming.

programme.title: How Do They Do It?
programme.desc: The mining of precious opals beneath a hot desert, the making of nougat and how stunt planes are built.

programme.title: Embarrassing Fat Bodies
programme.desc: Pixie McKenna encounters three huge hernias, and Christian Jessen meets Malissa Jones, who, aged 18, became one of the youngest patients in Britain to undergo an operation to fit a gastric band in 2008.

programme.title: Forensic Detectives
programme.desc: How forensic experts can use even the tiniest pieces of hair or carpet fibre to identify a criminal.

programme.title: Murder on CCTV
programme.desc: The case of devoted wife and hardworking paralegal Cynthia Langrall. When the 57-year-old was shot dead on her morning run, police were baffled as to who would commit the crime. Neighbours told police that they heard two gunshots and a few had spotted a car in the area that was caught on some CCTV footage.

programme.title: Murder Comes to Town
programme.desc: The New Year's Eve 2000 murders of Carl and JoAnna Dutcher and their 15-year-old grandson Tony, in the tiny Rocky Mountain outpost of Guffey. It transpired a school friend of Tony's, Scott Grimes, committed the act because he felt pressured by an older peer group with which he was associated.

programme.title: FBI Files
programme.desc: Bureau agents notice a pattern emerging when they investigate a series of violent carjackings around Washington DC in 1992.

programme.title: Animal Cops Phoenix
programme.desc: The story of Oscar, a dog that was brought back from the brink of death by the Arizona Humane Society, before being adopted by Animal Planet producer Michael Massey.

programme.title: Bondi Vet
programme.desc: Chris Brown and Lisa Chimes head out to the Blue Mountains after some of the most intense bushfires on record, to help pets and wildlife in the fire zone.

programme.title: Say Yes to the Dress
programme.desc: Persia is in search of a specific dress, but no one can locate it, while NFL stars Thomas and Julius Jones secretly plan to purchase their sister Katrice's gown.

programme.title: Say Yes to the Dress
programme.desc: Katie is looking for a dress to celebrate her new beginning following a lung transplant, while Christy comes in for her first fitting after losing more than 11 stone.

programme.title: Say Yes to the Dress: Atlanta
programme.desc: A widow about to remarry finds trying on dresses brings back painful memories, and another bride insists on a last-minute alteration to her gown.

programme.title: Bondi Vet
programme.desc: Chris Brown treats dalmatian puppy Hugo, who is in trouble after eating a corn on the cob, and shar pei Mr Wilson, who is losing his sight. Lisa tries to save a puppy that has swallowed something dangerous and Chris helps a tiny wallaroo found in its dead mother's pouch.

programme.title: Bondi Vet
programme.desc: Australian vet Chris Brown has an encounter with a python called Queen Bee, which has toothache. Plus, Lucky the cat's name proves misleading when it is poisoned by paracetamol.

programme.title: Animal Cops Philadelphia
programme.desc: Derek Schlitter seeks justice for a puppy he finds left for dead in a backyard.

programme.title: Animal Cops Philadelphia
programme.desc: The investigation of an illegal cock-fighting ring reveals deliberate cruelty to the birds.

programme.title: Money for Nothing
programme.desc: Jay Blades salvages three items bound for the skip in Walsall, featuring a Lloyd Loom-style laundry basket, a reclining chair and an oak writing bureau.

programme.title: Forensic Detectives
programme.desc: How tiny shreds of evidence, such as a tooth filling or fibres from clothing, can be crucial in proving the guilt or innocence of suspects.

programme.title: Disappeared
programme.desc: The case of 30-year-old teacher and former beauty queen Tara Grinstead, who vanished from her Georgia home on October 24, 2005. An abandoned latex glove was found in her backyard and police learned she had enjoyed a complex series of relationships with men.

programme.title: Disappeared
programme.desc: The case of 17-year-old Kara Kopetsky, who failed to return home from her Missouri school in May 2007. As the investigation proceeded a few unsettling clues occurred - a restraining order was required against an ex-boyfriend, unconfirmed sightings were made in a nearby town and another local girl disappeared.

programme.title: Say Yes to the Dress: Atlanta
programme.desc: A customer invites her fiance's ex-girlfriend to the salon, and while Tracy wants a short dress, her partner would prefer her to have a long gown.

programme.title: Say Yes to the Dress: Atlanta
programme.sub-title: The Girl with the Dragon Tattoo
programme.desc: Lacey wants a dress that will show off her very large back tattoo, but her mother wants it fully covered.

programme.title: Say Yes to the Dress: Atlanta
programme.sub-title: Two Mums Are Better Than None
programme.desc: The competition gets fierce when Hannah brings both her mum and stepmother to help her choose a dress, while Kourtney suffers due to her mother's absence.

programme.title: Say Yes to the Dress: Atlanta
programme.desc: JoLee's mother would be happy to see her daughter walk down the aisle in any white piece of clothing - so long as it hides her figure.

programme.title: Say Yes to the Dress: Bridesmaids
programme.desc: Angie has always dreamed of a laidback country wedding - but her sister Carolina wants her bridesmaid dress to be sparkly, and is determined to get her way.

programme.title: Say Yes to the Dress: Bridesmaids
programme.desc: A maid of honour turns into a monster when it is pointed out she is the only unmarried maid - and when the tension rises, it is left to the bride-to-be to save the day.

programme.title: Say Yes to the Dress: Big Bliss
programme.desc: A bride comes in for alterations to her dress, while Camille and Randy take up the challenge of creating a flattering look for a customer.

programme.title: Say Yes to the Dress: Big Bliss
programme.desc: A dress fitting becomes a bittersweet moment, while a customer looks for a gown that shows off her curves.

programme.title: Salvage Hunters
programme.desc: Drew Pritchard takes Te up to Wookey Hole, a small village near Somerset, to hunt for stock. Their first stop is the circus museum where Drew hopes to find treasure.

programme.title: Money for Nothing
programme.desc: Jay Blades salvages three items bound for the skip in Walsall, featuring a Lloyd Loom-style laundry basket, a reclining chair and an oak writing bureau.

programme.title: My 600lb Life
programme.desc: Mother-of-five Cynthia weighs 610 pounds and is physically unable to carry on her job as a special needs teacher. She resolves to lose weight for the sake of her career and her family.

programme.title: Sister Wives
programme.desc: The Browns sit down with NBC correspondent Tamron Hall to look back on events on camera and behind the scenes.

programme.title: Katie Price: My Crazy Life
programme.desc: Part two of two. There's seldom a dull moment with model, businesswoman and celebrity Katie Price, so cameras follow her life and activities.

programme.title: FBI Files
programme.desc: The Bureau's quest to identify members of terrorist group Omega 7, whose crimes include bombings and assassinations including that of Cuban refugee leader Eulalio Jose Negrin.
